newsitem.title: USA: Immune Response sees Q2 loss near Q1 level.
newsitem.headline: Immune Response sees Q2 loss near Q1 level.

text.p: Immune Response Corp expects to report a second quarter loss about equal to the first quarter loss of $0.39 per share, President and Chief Executive Officer Dennis Carlo said.
His forecast compares with analysts' consensus estimate of $0.42 per share, according to First Call.

Carlo also said he expects the company to generate about $1 million in revenues in the quarter from its partnership with Bayer AG, with which it is collaborating on a gene therapy product for the treatment of hemophilia.
Immune Response, a development stage company, has a treatment for HIV in Phase III clinical trials and a rheumatoid arthritis treatment set to begin Phase III trials.
